SENT.plain: Cerebral vasospasm induced by aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage is still a leading cause of morbidity and death
This 50-year-old man underwent surgery for aneurysm clipping
After the aneurysm was clipped, papaverine was instilled into the surgical area
Bradycardia, hypotension, and sinus arrest developed in the first minute after applying the papaverine
Thus, the authors concluded that the application of papaverine to the surgical area can result in fatal bradycardia and hypotension
